newsitem.title: POLAND: BRE ups zloty depo rates after NBP rise.
newsitem.headline: BRE ups zloty depo rates after NBP rise.

text.p: Bank Rozwoju Eksportu said on Monday it would raise interest rates on term zloty deposits by 0.23-2.31 percent and cut interest on term dollar deposits by 0.05-0.3 point from Tuesday.
New rates for zloty deposits range from 19 percent for one month to 18.74 percent for 12 months, while dollar deposit rates range from 4.33 to 4.86 percent.
It did not say if the bank would also change its credit rates and the bank's press office had no comment on credit rate movements.
BRE's action follows a move on Monday by the National Bank of Poland to boost interest rates by between 2.0 and 2.5 percent to 27 and 24.5 percent, respectively.
